posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
This one is about natural/ creature weapons.

Now, I know with Dragon Shape, Weapon Focus: Unarmed and its Epic counterpart doesn't work, but Improved Critical: Unarmed does. So the first part of this should be simple enough. Does the same hold true for all druid shapes?

The second part is to ask whether there is merit in taking Unarmed Fighting and its Improved version (to avoid AoOs when attacking in animal form)?

I know it wouldn't matter if I were taking even 1 level of Monk, but it ain't allowed with Barbarian. And the character I'm working on is definitely a Barb (it would be so much easier if he were a Fighter, but you play what you're dealt, right?). Also, he will only be using Wildshape: Dire Bear and Dire Wolf from his Druid levels. My current thinking is a Druid 18 (he is never seen casting spells, so undispellabilty and some of the meta magic feats won't really be needed)/ Barbarian 16 (for Terrifying Rage)/ CoT 6 (for 3 bonus feats and +3 to saves), but that may change.

Thanks again!
